summary: Craft that awesome-looking Cultist armour from Dragonborn for yourself - in full cloth, light, or heavy! Includes SKYRE VERSION, tempering, fixed sounds, material keywords (for mod compatibility), and moar
descriptionHtml:
REQUIRES DRAGONBORN DLC

Isn't it almost MEAN how one of the most badass-looking sets in Dragonborn is a nigh-useless mix of cloth, light armour, and heavy armour? And then they went and enchanted one of the pieces! Bah, well there goes my hopes of--
OH WAIT CREATION KIT



TO INSTALL:
Simply place in your Skryim/Data directory, and activate. Voil√†!


ABOUT:
A total of 12 crafting recipes, all eight armour pieces can be tempered!

HEAVY SET is equivalent to EBONY (at half weight) and thus requires ebony perk and is found under 'ebony'.
LIGHT SET is equivalent to GLASS (at half weight) and thus requires glass perk and is found under 'glass'.
CLOTH can be crafted immediately using linen (typically found in draugr barrows) and is found under 'clothing'.

The head/masks of all sets require, and are tempered with, mammoth tusks (so get hunting!).
The bodies and gloves, including cloth, of all sets require a single corundum ingot (for the arm decor) but are tempered with their own set material (ebony or malachite).
Cultists equipment doesn't change (their robes are still enchanted), though the names of their other equipment may be changed as warranted.


-->ALL CRAFTABLES ARE UNENCHANTED for your pleasure!
-->Fixed/added pickup/drop sounds!
-->Costs are consistent across all types (no spamming easy-mode armour for you).
-->As original, items do not drop in the world (just the heavy head, light gloves, and cloth boots cultists already spawn with)
-->All have full keywords for material and slots (meaning mods that provide bonuses, like SkyRe, will recognise them!)


Two versions: vanilla (for standard armour ratings) and SkyRe (since SkyRe has increase armour/damage scores for advanced combat).


All names are "Cultist [...]".
CLOTH: Shoes, Gloves, Robe, Hood
LIGHT: Boots, Bracers, Armor, Mask
HEAVY: Greaves, Gauntlets, Cuirass, Helm
author: snackrat
